introduction.description: There are different types of waste generated by offices and they need to be properly segregated, collected and taken care of to minimize their impact on health and environment: electronic waste, paper/ plastic/ glass/ metal waste, hazardous waste, food waste, etc.
introduction.importance: It is essential to know what you can monitor and improve, to better manage your waste. Choose from specialised suppliers what is most suitable for your company.
introduction.singapore_context: In Singapore, we dispose of 8,284,000 kg of waste a day. It is a 7 fold increase over the past 45 years. Our only landfill, Semakau Island, will run out of space by 2035. (Source: Zero Waste SG)
introduction.additional_resource: Learn more about Waste Management in Singapore in resources section

solutions.title: Measure & Monitor
solutions.principle: If you don't measure it, you can't manage it! Measuring your waste is a key step for a green office.
actions: Implement a procedure to measure the most relevant waste streams (general waste and recyclables) per floor or per department. The measure of recyclables can be broken down per type of recyclables such as paper, e-waste, plastic...
Set annually waste reduction targets to continuously improve.
resources: Zero Waste City guide to start a recycling program in your office
Singapore NEA 3R Guidebook for Offices (Page 14 onwards)

solutions.title: Conduct a Waste Audit
solutions.description: Conduct a waste audit. The audit can be conducted by internal staff or by an external professional.
goals: Quantify and qualify the different waste streams
Assess the waste management infrastructures and practices
Submit a series of recommendations to reduce waste, improve reuse and recycling, and reduce costs

solutions.title: Improve Waste Equipment
includes: Installing a set of bin stations including at minimum 1 general waste bin, 1 recycling bin, and 1 paper bin. The combination of bins depends on the types of waste generated in the office
Installing 1 paper bin next to each printer
requirements: Ensure consistency in the selection of bins and communication tools (same colour, visible name and with a symbol)
Make sure that the cleaning services and the contractor are aware of the waste management requirements
solutions.resource: More details at Zero Waste City on desk bin vs centralised bins

solutions.title: Train all stakeholders

stakeholders.office_staff: which must know how to segregate their trash
stakeholders.cleaning_company: which must maintain the segregation from the bins to the collector
stakeholders.waste_collector: which must maintain the segregation from the 2 above up to the Material Recovery Facility

actions: Provide them clear information and guidance
Train them on a regular basis
Design the trainings with a specialist
solutions.staff_training: For your office staff, train them for waste management at your office but also at their home. Start with helping them understand what is recyclable or not (NEA guide available).

solutions.title: Select appropriate waste contractors (e-waste)
solutions.description: Contract with appropriate servicers for the collection of e-waste & hazardous waste.
solutions.building_management: In case e-waste management falls under your building management's responsibility, talk with your building manager to ensure collection is properly done.
solutions.regulation: Under the EPR (Extended Producer Responsibility) on e-waste, suppliers of electronic goods have to take back and send old products to licensed recyclers.
solutions.personal_disposal: You have personal e-waste to discard? Here is a list of all collection points available in Singapore from NEA.

solutions.title: Select appropriate waste contractors (paper)
solutions.description: Contract with appropriate servicers for the collection of paper waste.
solutions.building_management: In case paper waste management falls under your building management's responsibility, talk with your building manager to ensure collection is properly done.

solutions.title: Select appropriate waste contractors (others)
solutions.minimum_requirement: At least, select proper collectors for paper and e-waste for your office and install dedicated bins.
solutions.building_management: In case waste management falls under your building management's responsibility, talk with your building manager to ensure collection is properly done.
solutions.regulation: Under the EPR (Extended Producer Responsibility) on e-waste, suppliers of electronic goods have to take back and send old products to licensed recyclers.

solutions.title: Conduct Regular Monitoring of Waste Management
solutions.description: Monitor results, correct wrong practices, set higher targets annually. Ask the help of a professional if need be.
solutions.resource: Find out more at Zero Waste City on 5 tips for improving recycling in your offices
